holidays.name: International Bacon Day
holidays.description: A sizzling celebration dedicated to the crispy, savory magic of bacon. Bacon lovers around the world fry up strips and indulge in all things bacon-flavored!
holidays.origin: Created in the early 2000s by bacon enthusiasts to honor the beloved breakfast staple.
holidays.funFact: Did you know? Americans consume over 2 billion pounds of bacon each year — that's a lot of sizzle!

holidays.name: Eat Outside Day
holidays.description: An invitation to take your meals outdoors and enjoy food alfresco, whether it’s a picnic, barbecue, or simple snack in the park.
holidays.origin: Origin unknown but promoted by outdoor lifestyle advocates and foodies to appreciate nature and good eats.
holidays.funFact: Eating outdoors can boost your mood and even improve digestion thanks to fresh air and sunlight.

holidays.name: Trail Mix Day
holidays.description: A crunchy, sweet, and salty salute to the perfect hiking snack – trail mix! Time to mix your favorite nuts, seeds, dried fruits, and chocolate.
holidays.origin: Started by snack lovers and outdoor enthusiasts to recognize this convenient energy booster.
holidays.funFact: The U.S. military first popularized trail mix by packaging it for soldiers as an easy-to-carry snack.

holidays.name: Maryland Day
holidays.description: Commemorates the landing of the first European settlers in Maryland in 1634, celebrating the history and heritage of the Old Line State.
holidays.origin: Established officially by the state of Maryland to honor its founding date.
holidays.funFact: August 31 marks Maryland's founding — home to the famous blue crab and Chesapeake Bay!
